moves.1. d4 d5 2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 c5 4. cxd5 cxd4: All the games began from this position.
moves.8. Nf3 Nf6 9. Qb3 Na5 10. Qc2 Bc5 11. e3: Development is finally complete for both sides. Now the game begins.
moves.17... Rad8 18. Na4: Looking to exchange Queens. The simpler I make the game, the more prominent my Pawn edge becomes.
moves.20... Rxd1+ 21. Rxd1: My opponent, to my surprise, voluntarily exchanges Rooks.
moves.23... Rd8 24. Rxd8+: I'll gladly trade the last major pieces.
moves.25... Nc6 26. Bf4: Placing it in a protected position.
moves.29... b5 30. Nc5: Setting a trap: if 30...NxRP? 31 N-Q7 leaves both Black pieces en prise.
moves.30... Kg7 31. Ne4: Black doesn't fall into it, but I attack the B anyway.
moves.31... Bd8 32. Ke2: Trying to centralize the King. I offered a draw around this point, and my opponent declined it.
moves.32... Na1 33. Nd2: With Black's Knight in the corner, I may be able to trap it...
moves.35... Bf6 36. Bc3: If 36... BxB, 37 KxB followed by 38... K-N2 wins the cornered Knight.
moves.36... Be5 37. Bxe5: I still win the trapped Knight.
moves.39... Nxb3 40. Kxb3: Black at least gets a Pawn.
moves.40... Kd5 41. f3: New task: advance a Pawn to the 8th rank.
moves.45... axb4 46. Nd2 Kb5 47. Nc4: Preparing to shift to the K-side.
moves.47... Kc5 48. Ne5 Kd5 49. Nf7: Forcing the win of a K-side Pawn.
moves.49... h4 50. gxh4 h5 51. Kxb4: Eliminating the lone remaining potential danger.
moves.51... Ke6 52. Ng5+ Kf6 53. Kc4: Now i just have to move the King into position.
moves.55... f4 56. e4: This will be the decisive Pawn.
moves.58... Kf8 59. Kd7: Black resigns, as the Pawn will inevitably become a Queen.
